Chaim Grade's works covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo", "Musarnikes", "Dojrois", "Oyf di Hurves", "Pleitim", "Farvoksene Vegn", "Der Mames Tzavoe", "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern", "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner", "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah", "Hurbin", and "Vilna" with different parts like "Di Shank". Chaim Grade's works in section 1 include titles such as "Vilna", "Di Shank", "Der Ger-Tzadik", "Di Hiter fun der Shtot", "Unter di Gevelbte Toyern", "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite", "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir", "Dos Alte Hoyz", "Fun Unter der Erd", and "Yury Goresha". In section 1, Chaim Grade's works include titles like "Yury Goresha", "Alte Boherim", "In Gerangl mitn Malah", "Chaim Nachman Bialik", "H. Leivik, der Poet fun Laydn un Goyrl", "H. Leivik in Mayn Lehn and Shafn", "Itzik Manger, der Poet fun Shaynkayt un Shpil", "Dray Yiddishe Classiker, Mendele, I.L. Peretz, Sholem-Alaychem", and "Anski, der Maskl, Revolutioner un Baal Tshuvah". In section 2, Chaim Grade discusses various topics such as problems in Yiddish literature, his path in Yiddish literature, his encounter with Soviet Yiddish writers, three dramatic poems he wrote, and three main motives in his works. Chaim Grade discusses various topics in his works, including Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, The Sabbath in Yiddish Literature, Mussarists and Lithuanian Yeshivas, Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov, Rabbi Israel Salanter, The Talmudic Scholar in Yiddish Literature, and Vilna's Jewish community. In Vilna, there were memorial services for Count Potocki and discussions on Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and struggle for Jewish life worldwide. Additionally, there was a question about Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia being Marranos, and Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman was mentioned. The Song of Songs was also discussed as a love song, national anthem, and mystical poem. In Vilna, memorial services were held for Count Potocki and discussions on Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and Jewish life worldwide. The Song of Songs was also discussed as a love song, national anthem, and mystical poem. Lectures and essays included topics like Saffed and Mount Miron, the people and greening of Israel, Vilna's uniqueness, Histadruth, Jewish life in Vilna before World War II, the new Hebrew literature in Israel, and Yiddish folk life and tradition in Lithuania. Chaim Grade's works include "The New Hebrew Literature and the Young Generation in Israel", "The Survivors", "Thirty Years Later", "The Soil and the Legend of the Land of Israel", "The Last Controversies Among the Rabbis of Vilna", and "American Yiddish Poets".
